By god, 38 GB's.. this is going to take a longgg time to download.
Just got this from some foreign country. You want to know it's real or fake, just join to see how many leechers are sucking on it.
is 38 gb the real size? i mean that its remuxed maybe thats why its 38 gb.

Thanks for the upload! you have the first 1080p Avatar on TBP lol. too bad you couldn't have recoded it 2pass H.264 to around 8GB-14GB and would have been just as good. but i'm not complaining. hope ya got a good upload pipe, cause 38GB is gonan take forever. already 1200 leechers O.o
I just don't see how 38gigs for a movie is worth downloading. You are making history tho lol!
Doesn't H.264 recoding hurt the image quality? This is about the size of 3 usual 1080p features. But how many movies's box office sum Avatar has made? You don't think Avatar deserve this size?

True, a movie this epic deserves to be seen in prestine quality.

but you can get near-perfect quality in half the size (or even 1/3rd) with high quality H.264 2-pass encoding ^^

Thanks again though, I really did want to see this in perfect quality. already 6 seeders? how is this possible?
Please provide more info....specifically does this have subs (not just the hard coded stuff when the aliens are talking)?

this file size is fine, you can burn this to a blue ray disc DUHH!!

im going to watch it on my 17 inch monitor though haha
i wouldnt trust it joy2000 first upload but i could be wrong we will see

Gaaahhh!! a raw 38GB.....

Im sure someone gonna re-encode it.

Avatar *2009* [1080p.Bluray.DTS.m2ts] [ENG]
on demonoid
and it is 45.52 GB

the codec is right in the title - AVC, or in other words: H.264/MPEG-4

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.264/MPEG-4_AVC

Hmm... if the original is 45GB then this torrent is a recode. 

any additional info like bitrate and such would be nice
or maybe this is a stream copy to .ts and only has one language? could all the other languages in the demonoid torrent account for 7GB?
That 45.2 gb torrent has been pulled from Demonoid
>2k leechers and not a single seeder...LMFAO!!!
Omg! Avatar 2 will come out when i finish with this download.

What's the data rate per second? It would be good to know because size doesn't always mean a higher bitrate. (compared to a smaller size with a different codec)

Thanks, and congrats on being the first :) I think I'll break a terabyte down (and 1.5 up) with this!
See the REMUX in the title, it's lossless repackaging of Blu-ray data, sans craps like the menu, etc. That's why it's smaller than the original disk size.

I finished this file yesterday, I'm seeding. Having a hard time getting it to play smooth, my computer isn't too slow (2ghz core 2 duo, 4GB ram, geforce 8600GT) it's completely unplayable in VLC (skips a lot) same with KMplayer, and MPC/nero with DXVA decoding, but "Microsoft DTV-DVD Video Decoder" works alright in windows media player and KMplayer. It also plays alright in Media Player Classic Home Cinema, with DXVA turned off. Still not playing as smooth as i'd like though :(

MPC using the default ffdshow decoder definitely seems to play it the smoothest on my mediocre system. 

if anyone is having problems playing this, i highly recommend you install "Media Player Classic - HomeCinema"

For anyone that is curious I was downloading this one and the "AMIABLE" one (mkv, 10.9GB), and took screenshots of the same frame in both versions. The quality on this one is definitely higher in the still, but in motion I can't entirely tell the difference (granted it's only from ~1s of motion before this one skips ahead). Also, there are 2 black pixels at the top in this version, losing those same 2 pixels off the bottom. Again, I doubt those 2 pixels contain anything game breaking, but just FYI.

The screenshots:
http://i.imgur.com/QHzlF.jpg - This one
http://i.imgur.com/g9R3M.jpg - The 10.9GB one

If this is from an American Blu Ray,

try my subtitle which has been copied (ripped) directly from the American Blu Ray release.  It includes all the Na'vi spoken dialogue as well.  It's perfectly synced as well obviously.

http://subscene.com/english/Avatar/subtitle-324486.aspx

I see a lot of these Avatar releases are from Region 2 Blu Rays.  If you try to use Region 2 subtitles with Region 1 video, it won't sync properly.

Also, for the record, Region 1 Avatar was rippable from the date it was released (April 21st).

hey guys i posted earlier that this remux has absolutley no subtitles including the subtitles for when they are speaking navi. well someone on the internet figured out how to seperate the forced subtitles from the english subtitles here is the link. http://forum.videohelp.com/attachments/1566-1272312147/Avatar.track_4608.zip

now keep in mind this is a pgs stream and should only be used if u plan on remuxing the video and buring it on a bluray in bdmv format. for all you other people who wish to keep it in a mkv container you must convert it to srt format first.

my previous comment had a link to the navi subtitles (subtitles for the non english parts) in pgs format. here is the link to srt format of those same subtitles: 

http://forum.videohelp.com/attachments/1548-1272251091/Avatar.(2009).srt

if you are using media player classic to play the movie renaming the subtitle file to the same name as the movie file should work. if that doesnt work you need to download tsmuxer and mkvmerge gui here are the links:

http://www.smlabs.net/tsMuxer/tsMuxeR_1.10.6.zip

http://www.videohelp.com/download/mkvtoolnix-unicode-3.3.0-setup.exe

ok, now what you do is drag the m2ts file into the tsmuxer gui and select demux under the output section, also dont forget to select the output path so you know where the demuxed files will be. next you open mkvmerge gui (after installing mkvtoolnix first obviously) drag the two demuxed streams (should be a 264 file and a dts file of some kind), and the srt subtitle you downloaded into mkvmergegui. select your output path and name and hit start. after that you should have a mkv file with video audio and subtitle. note: some players dont support dtshd-ma, if this is the case with your player when u demux the video and audio for the audio check the box in tsmuxer that says downconvert dts-hd to dts.

-> oxycodone hey man is there any transcoding and quality loss by demuxing an remuxing the streams when including the sub file? is there any potential for A/V sync issues in this process? is this cpu intensive? finally i assume over 120GB of storage is required for this process>? 40 for the source, 40 for demultiplexed streams and a final 40GB fore the merged final outputted file?
clarifications appreciated. i'll probably do this myself if i can get onto an M$ windoze puta if cpu isn't too taxing, i don't have windows on my 8 core nehalem macpro monster. 

no there is no quality loss from remultiplexing video/audio streams. basically all your doing extracting the raw streams from the container file. think of the m2ts container file a .zip with two files in it. and yes demux/remuxing can be demanding on your cpu. this 38gig file will probably take 30 or more minutes to demux and another 30 or more to remux.(thats based on my experience with q9200 core 2 quad 8 gig of ram). and no you shouldnt have any audio sync problem from remuxing audio/video streams, unless the source file was already out of sync.

yes they do, you just have to do a little research on subtitles and the different subtitle formats.  i used to download bluray movies and couldnt figure out why i was having so many problems, so i started reading on the subject.  video/audio/subtitles streams are alot easier to get working then most people think. most media players will not support .sup subtitles in a raw m2ts container unless it is in a proper bluray structure either on disc or in an image file.      personally i think if someone is going to upload a bluray movie in a single file it should be in an mkv container NOT m2ts. thats why so many people are having trouble with this movie.

is completely true, i demuxed with tsmuxer, added the subs, and made into mkv with mkvtoolnix.
you only have to make sure you set the frames per second to 24000/1001 (this is 23.976 fps) cause the movie has this as you will see in tsmuxer, if you dont the audio will get more and more out of sync the further in the movie you are.

For everyone that is having problems skipping with Movist on Mac, just go to "Preferences" under the "Movist" tab in the upper-left hand corner.  Under the "General" tab in the Preferences menu, where you see "10sec" change that to like "500" sec and you'll be able to skip, back and forth by pressing the right or left arrows.

For everyone that is having problems skipping with Movist on Mac, just go to "Preferences" under the "Movist" tab in the upper-left hand corner. Under the "General" tab in the Preferences menu, where you see "10sec" change that to like "500" sec and you'll be able to skip, back and forth by pressing the right or left arrows.
